Description: PER THE SETTLEMENT AGREEMENT THE MAJOR PURPOSE OF THE MUTUAL-BENEFIT PROJECTS IS TO RESTORE, PRESERVE, AND PROTECT THE TAOS PUEBLOS BUFFALO PASTURE, A NATURAL WETLAND WITHIN THE PUEBLO. THE MUTUAL-BENEFIT PROJECTS ARE DESIGNED TO MINIMIZE THE DEPLETION OF THE GROUNDWATER RESOURCES CONNECTED WITH THE BUFFALO PASTURE AND TO MOVE NON-PUEBLO GROUNDWATER PUMPING AWAY FROM THE BUFFALO PASTURE.THE NEW EL PRADO WATER AND SANITATION DISTRICT SUPPLY WELLS WILL PROVIDE GROUNDWATER PRODUCTION CAPACITY NECESSARY TO SATISFY GROWING DEMAND ON THEIR SYSTEMWHILE MOVING THEIR PUMPING AWAY FROM BUFFALO PASTURE.EL PRADO WATER AND SANITATION DISTRICT (EPWSD) PHASE II WATER CONSTRUCTION PROJECT SHALL CONSTRUCT WATER LINES AND A NEW 500,000-GALLON STORAGE TANK.

PER THE SETTLEMENT AGREEMENT, THE MAJOR PURPOSE OF THE MUTUAL-BENEFIT PROJECTS IS TO RESTORE, PRESERVE, AND PROTECT THE TAOS PUEBLOS BUFFALO PASTURE, A NATURAL WETLAND WITHIN THE PUEBLO. THE MUTUAL-BENEFIT PROJECTS ARE DESIGNED TO MINIMIZE THE DEPLETION OF THE GROUNDWATER RESOURCES CONNECTED WITH THE BUFFALO PASTURE AND TO MOVE NON-PUEBLO GROUNDWATER PUMPING AWAY FROM THE BUFFALO PASTURE. THE TOWN OF TAOS NEW SUPPLY WELLS WILL PROVIDE GROUNDWATER PRODUCTION CAPACITY NECESSARY TO SATISFY GROWING DEMAND ON THEIR SYSTEM.

UNDER THIS AGREEMENT, THE RECIPIENT SHALL PLAN, PERMIT, DESIGN, ENGINEER, CONSTRUCT, AND EQUIP THE FOLLOWING FIVE (5) DEEP WATER WELLS DESCRIBED IN AND IN ACCORDANCE WITH THE TAOS INDIAN WATER RIGHTS SETTLEMENT AGREEMENT (SETTLEMENT AGREEMENT) MUTUAL BENEFITS PROJECTS.
INDIAN WATER RIGHTS SETTLEMENT LLANO QUEMADO
